positive.review:
It is for me, hands down the best game in the entire series. Very intuitive mechanics, simple to learn yet hard to master. Plenty of unique officers, clans, and start dates to choose from, even if in Koei fashion many are locked behind DLCs. Many veterans prefer the deeper mechanics of SoI, but if you're new or would like to try out basically the most polished game of the series, I wholeheartedly recommend this as your starting point. 

[spoiler] I would prefer it if ROTK XV is just Awakening set in the Three Kingdoms period [/spoiler]
I watched a 4 hour long video essay on this, and fell in love immediately,, now a big fan.
good at beginning

I like this game, I which Nobunagas Ambition sphere of influence ascension had some of the features this game has, even without those features ascension stands as the best game in the series. im not going to thumbs down this game but it has 2 major issues that i find to be extremely annoying, the main one is sieges, sieges in this game are terrible, you are timed on your sieges leave little room for strategy and thought process, if you lose 2 armies, consider the siege a failure. this is extremely unrrealistic, as it should be affected by ATTRITION and how much SUPPLIES you have. you cant really make memorable and epic battles because of that. this timed system of break this to gain time or if you lose this unit you lose time, is ludicrous.  thats the major issues for me, some minor ones are not being able to climb your way up the rankings like you could in ascension, you have to be a daimyo no matter what, its not a deal breaker but variety is often nice to have. this game certainly has a lot of positives, visually and mechanically. I just wished they had built upon the gem that ascension was.

Edit after replaying sphere of influence ascension.(A game i have 135 hours on ps5) Look if you want graphics and more animations, with some new mechanics implemented, definitely try this game as a veteran of the previous titles. I wouldn't recommend this game to a new player at all, the historical quests just arent as abundant as in sphere of influence. I love this game only because of all the beautiful memories I made with ascension where I can just play this game without having to worry about history accuracy or anything else. Ascension stands the best game in the nobunagas ambition series. :)

Awesome game. Runs great on steam deck at maximum graphics settings at 30 fps.

Use GE Proton 9-2
Steam deck launch options:
SteamDeck=0 GST_PLUGIN_FEATURE_RANK=protonaudioconverterbin:NONE %command%

If you've already run the game once on your steam deck, in the game folder it will have created some new .exe files that end in "SD". Delete those files. 

Running SteamDeck=0 makes the game think it's not a steam deck, allowing you to configure controls and also change graphics settings. The code after that in the launch options makes sure audio plays during cut scenes.

Make sure to download and use GE Proton 9-2 compatability.

In steam, click the properties option for the game and change the game resolution to 1600x900 and enable the option for "Set resolution for internal and external display"

In game settings, run full screen, choose best graphics option, and choose 1600x900 resolution. I use Decky powertools and DISABLE "SMT" so the game runs on only 4x CPU cores and limit them to 2500hz. I also use stretch screen to fill in the small black bars at the top and bottom of the screen.

With these settings, I'm running 30fps 100% consistently with temperatures hovering around 77 and 80 degrees. 

Once again, fantastic game and runs so well on steam deck. I've got a 4090 and a 4k tv, but I prefer to play this hand held. The UI is perfect for it. It's so much fun.

It is for me, hands down the best game in the entire series. Very intuitive mechanics, simple to learn yet hard to master. Plenty of unique officers, clans, and start dates to choose from, even if in Koei fashion many are locked behind DLCs. Many veterans prefer the deeper mechanics of SoI, but if you're new or would like to try out basically the most polished game of the series, I wholeheartedly recommend this as your starting point. 

[spoiler] I would prefer it if ROTK XV is just Awakening set in the Three Kingdoms period [/spoiler]
非常好秀吉，使我的信长旋转
I watched a 4 hour long video essay on this, and fell in love immediately,, now a big fan.
good at beginning
Nice!
Addictive
peak gaming

I like this game, I which Nobunagas Ambition sphere of influence ascension had some of the features this game has, even without those features ascension stands as the best game in the series. im not going to thumbs down this game but it has 2 major issues that i find to be extremely annoying, the main one is sieges, sieges in this game are terrible, you are timed on your sieges leave little room for strategy and thought process, if you lose 2 armies, consider the siege a failure. this is extremely unrrealistic, as it should be affected by ATTRITION and how much SUPPLIES you have. you cant really make memorable and epic battles because of that. this timed system of break this to gain time or if you lose this unit you lose time, is ludicrous.  thats the major issues for me, some minor ones are not being able to climb your way up the rankings like you could in ascension, you have to be a daimyo no matter what, its not a deal breaker but variety is often nice to have. this game certainly has a lot of positives, visually and mechanically. I just wished they had built upon the gem that ascension was.

Edit after replaying sphere of influence ascension.(A game i have 135 hours on ps5) Look if you want graphics and more animations, with some new mechanics implemented, definitely try this game as a veteran of the previous titles. I wouldn't recommend this game to a new player at all, the historical quests just arent as abundant as in sphere of influence. I love this game only because of all the beautiful memories I made with ascension where I can just play this game without having to worry about history accuracy or anything else. Ascension stands the best game in the nobunagas ambition series. :)

Awesome game. Runs great on steam deck at maximum graphics settings at 30 fps.

Use GE Proton 9-2
Steam deck launch options:
SteamDeck=0 GST_PLUGIN_FEATURE_RANK=protonaudioconverterbin:NONE %command%

If you've already run the game once on your steam deck, in the game folder it will have created some new .exe files that end in "SD". Delete those files. 

Running SteamDeck=0 makes the game think it's not a steam deck, allowing you to configure controls and also change graphics settings. The code after that in the launch options makes sure audio plays during cut scenes.

Make sure to download and use GE Proton 9-2 compatability.

In steam, click the properties option for the game and change the game resolution to 1600x900 and enable the option for "Set resolution for internal and external display"

In game settings, run full screen, choose best graphics option, and choose 1600x900 resolution. I use Decky powertools and DISABLE "SMT" so the game runs on only 4x CPU cores and limit them to 2500hz. I also use stretch screen to fill in the small black bars at the top and bottom of the screen.

With these settings, I'm running 30fps 100% consistently with temperatures hovering around 77 and 80 degrees. 

Once again, fantastic game and runs so well on steam deck. I've got a 4090 and a 4k tv, but I prefer to play this hand held. The UI is perfect for it. It's so much fun.

It is for me, hands down the best game in the entire series. Very intuitive mechanics, simple to learn yet hard to master. Plenty of unique officers, clans, and start dates to choose from, even if in Koei fashion many are locked behind DLCs. Many veterans prefer the deeper mechanics of SoI, but if you're new or would like to try out basically the most polished game of the series, I wholeheartedly recommend this as your starting point. 

[spoiler] I would prefer it if ROTK XV is just Awakening set in the Three Kingdoms period [/spoiler]

If you've already run the game once on your steam deck, in the game folder it will have created some new .exe files that end in "SD". Delete those files. 

Running SteamDeck=0 makes the game think it's not a steam deck, allowing you to configure controls and also change graphics settings. The code after that in the launch options makes sure audio plays during cut scenes.

Make sure to download and use GE Proton 9-2 compatability.

In steam, click the properties option for the game and change the game resolution to 1600x900 and enable the option for "Set resolution for internal and external display"

In game settings, run full screen, choose best graphics option, and choose 1600x900 resolution. I use Decky powertools and DISABLE "SMT" so the game runs on only 4x CPU cores and limit them to 2500hz. I also use stretch screen to fill in the small black bars at the top and bottom of the screen.

With these settings, I'm running 30fps 100% consistently with temperatures hovering around 77 and 80 degrees. 

Once again, fantastic game and runs so well on steam deck. I've got a 4090 and a 4k tv, but I prefer to play this hand held. The UI is perfect for it. It's so much fun.

It is for me, hands down the best game in the entire series. Very intuitive mechanics, simple to learn yet hard to master. Plenty of unique officers, clans, and start dates to choose from, even if in Koei fashion many are locked behind DLCs. Many veterans prefer the deeper mechanics of SoI, but if you're new or would like to try out basically the most polished game of the series, I wholeheartedly recommend this as your starting point. 

[spoiler] I would prefer it if ROTK XV is just Awakening set in the Three Kingdoms period [/spoiler]
非常好秀吉，使我的信长旋转
I watched a 4 hour long video essay on this, and fell in love immediately,, now a big fan.

I like this game, I which Nobunagas Ambition sphere of influence ascension had some of the features this game has, even without those features ascension stands as the best game in the series. im not going to thumbs down this game but it has 2 major issues that i find to be extremely annoying, the main one is sieges, sieges in this game are terrible, you are timed on your sieges leave little room for strategy and thought process, if you lose 2 armies, consider the siege a failure. this is extremely unrrealistic, as it should be affected by ATTRITION and how much SUPPLIES you have. you cant really make memorable and epic battles because of that. this timed system of break this to gain time or if you lose this unit you lose time, is ludicrous.  thats the major issues for me, some minor ones are not being able to climb your way up the rankings like you could in ascension, you have to be a daimyo no matter what, its not a deal breaker but variety is often nice to have. this game certainly has a lot of positives, visually and mechanically. I just wished they had built upon the gem that ascension was.

Edit after replaying sphere of influence ascension.(A game i have 135 hours on ps5) Look if you want graphics and more animations, with some new mechanics implemented, definitely try this game as a veteran of the previous titles. I wouldn't recommend this game to a new player at all, the historical quests just arent as abundant as in sphere of influence. I love this game only because of all the beautiful memories I made with ascension where I can just play this game without having to worry about history accuracy or anything else. Ascension stands the best game in the nobunagas ambition series. :)
